title: Understanding Addition Rules through Structured Discovery Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Learners possess intuitive addition-solving skills but lack understanding of rule-based systematic approaches. Blended learning (online modules + face-to-face discussions) maximizes effectiveness.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the principles of the '+1' addition rule (n + 1 and 1 + n) through structured discovery activities.
Learners establish strategies to solve problems by applying the '+1' rule across diverse number ranges.
Learners can transfer the trained 'near-doubles' strategy to untrained items with similar patterns.

Learners collaborate with a group of 3–4 peers to analyze patterns discovered while solving three types of addition problems (e.g., integers, fractions, polynomials) within two weeks and write a 500-character report explaining the generalizability of addition rules.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
